intro: Hieracium delegidoi, commonly known as the Sardinian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly Sardinia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium delegidoi is often found in coastal and inland regions, showing adaptability to various soil types.
